intro: Byttneria campicola, commonly known as the African tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by woody pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
